meanings.definition: To grant citizenship to a foreigner.
meanings.sent1: The country naturalised many immigrants last year.
meanings.sent2: The government naturalised the refugee after years of living in the country.
meanings.sent3: The mayor joked that he would naturalise all the tourists to boost the population.
meanings.sent4: The school naturalised the exchange student into their community with open arms.
meanings.sent5: The ceremony to naturalise new citizens was a joyous occasion.

meanings.definition: To adapt to a new environment or situation.
meanings.sent1: The plant naturalised quickly to the sunny climate.
meanings.sent2: The animal naturalised to its new home in the zoo.
meanings.sent3: The team naturalised to the coach's strict training regimen.
meanings.sent4: The student naturalised to the fast-paced city life after moving from a small town.
meanings.sent5: The robot naturalised to its programming flawlessly.

meanings.definition: To introduce a plant or animal to a new habitat and allow it to become established.
meanings.sent1: The conservationists naturalised the endangered species in the protected reserve.
meanings.sent2: The farmers naturalised a new crop to increase biodiversity.
meanings.sent3: The zookeepers naturalised the exotic bird to the aviary with care.
meanings.sent4: The gardeners naturalised the rare flower in the botanical garden.
meanings.sent5: The researchers naturalised the invasive species unintentionally, causing ecological imbalance.
